meanings.definition: To draw back or turn aside, as from fear or pain.
meanings.sent1: She blenched at the sight of the spider crawling towards her.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise made him blench and cover his ears.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie was so scary that even the tough guy blenched in fear.
meanings.sent4: His heart blenched at the thought of losing his best friend.
meanings.sent5: The sudden flash of lightning blenched the sky with brightness.

meanings.sent1: The child blenched when the doctor gave him a shot.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but blench when the cold water touched her skin.
meanings.sent3: He blenched comically when his friend tried to scare him with a fake spider.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected slap made him blench in pain.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat made him blench as if he had touched a hot stove.

meanings.sent1: Her face blenched when she heard the shocking news.
meanings.sent2: The cold wind made his cheeks blench in the winter air.
meanings.sent3: The joke was so funny that it made him blench with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight made the whole landscape blench in its silvery glow.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure made everyone blench in fear as it floated towards them.
